casebody.data:
Leslie I. ROGGE, Petitioner-Appellant, v. UNITED STATES of America, Respondent-Appellee. No. 71-2174. United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit. Jan. 19, 1972. Michael D. Garvey, Houger, Garvey, Schubert & Barnes, Seattle, Wash., for petitioner-appellant. Stan Pitkin, U. S. Atty., Charles Pinnell, Asst. U. S. Atty., Seattle, Wash., for respondent-appellee.

Before MERRILL, KOELSCH and HUFSTEDLER, Circuit Judges.

ORDER AFFIRMING JUDGMENT

The district court’s determinations that appellant’s pleas of guilty were intelligently made are not clearly erroneous.

Accordingly, the judgment denying appellant’s application — under 28 U.S.C. § 2255 — to set aside the convictions, is

Affirmed.
